title: Measuring text is improper in linux environment
body:
**Description**
Measuring text is improper in linux environment 

**Code**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
var paint = new SKPaint();
var bounds = new SKRect();
float width = paint.MeasureText("Locatio", ref bounds);

**Expected Behavior**
we want same width for the text in both windows and Linux environment

**Actual Behavior**
In windows environment text width is 39.
In Linux environment text width is 42.
 
**Basic Information**
- skiasharp Version: 1.59.3 
- IDE:  MonoDevelop

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: What font are you using on both systems? If you want the same results on both systems you need to use the same font file.

comments.author: MadhanKumarasamy
comments.body:
Thanks for your reply.

we have tried out in both windows and linux environment with same font but still does not get the same width as expected, we suspect that it might be an issue in Skia measure text. And so, we have created a separate forum https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/838 with more details for further follow up. 

Now we have closed this as duplicate.
